intro: Mentha spicata subsp. tomentosa, commonly known as woolly mint, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and aromatic, slightly minty scent. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with square stems and opposite leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Woolly mint is often used in culinary and medicinal applications due to its pleasant flavor and potential therapeutic properties.
